fullText: This cheerfully anachronistic musical comedy about the invention of the musical comedy is a kaleidoscope of inside jokes, self-referential gags and winking tributes to the theater.
dtliExcerpt: This cheerfully anachronistic musical comedy about the invention of the musical comedy is a kaleidoscope of inside jokes, self-referential gags and winking tributes to the theater.
bwwExcerpt: Unchecked enthusiasm is not always an asset in musical comedy, despite the genre's reputation for wholesale peppiness. "Something Rotten!"...dances dangerously on the line between tireless and tedious, and winds up collapsing into the second camp..."Sophomoric" is the right adjective for "Something Rotten!"...this production wallows in the puerile puns, giggly double-entendres, lip-smacking bad taste and goofy pastiche numbers often found in college revues...With his resolute jaw, gleaming smile
